entry.title: Github Trending and Good Stuff 2019-08-07
entry.content:
jupyter-notebook

NervanaSystems / distiller

Neural Network Distiller by Intel AI Lab: a Python package for neural network compression research. https://nervanasystems.github.io/distiller
Good Stuff

  • Quantization: Several new features in range-based linear quantization:
  • More control over post-training quantization configuration: Additional command line arguments in image classification sample.
  • We‚Äôve fixed a couple of Early Exit bugs, and improved the documentation
  • Support for quantization-aware training in the loop
  • Training with knowledge distillation, in conjunction with the other available pruning / regularization / quantization methods.
  • A set of Jupyter notebooks to plan experiments and analyze compression results. The graphs and visualizations you see on this page originate from the included Jupyter notebooks.
  • Sample implementations of published research papers, using library-provided building blocks. See the research papers discussions in our model-zoo.
    • Frequently-asked questions (FAQ)
    • Model zoo
    • Compression scheduling
    • Usage
    • Preparing a model for quantization
    • Tutorial: Using Distiller to prune a PyTorch language model
    • Tutorial: Pruning Filters & Channels
    • Tutorial: Post-Training Quantization of a Language Model
    • Post-training quantization command line examples
  • The set of notebooks that come with Distiller is described here, which also explains the steps to install the Jupyter notebook server.
  • The authors of the research papers implemented in the Distiller model-zoo have shared their research ideas, theoretical background and results.

MorvanZhou / PyTorch-Tutorial

Build your neural network easy and fast
Good Stuff

  • Visit Ëé´ÁÉ¶ Python for more.
  • Thanks for liufuyang‚Äôs notebook files which is a great contribution to this tutorial.
    • pyTorch basic
      • torch and numpy
      • Variable
      • Activation
    • Build your first network
      • Regression
      • Classification
      • An easy way
      • Save and reload
      • Train on batch
      • Optimizers
    • Advanced neural network
      • CNN
      • RNN-Classification
      • RNN-Regression
      • AutoEncoder
      • DQN Reinforcement Learning
      • A3C Reinforcement Learning
      • GAN (Generative Adversarial Nets) / Conditional GAN
    • Others (WIP)
      • Why torch dynamic
      • Train on GPU
      • Dropout
      • Batch Normalization

lse-me314 / lse-me314.github.io

ME314 2019 Course Website
Good Stuff

  • Detailed instructions can also be found here for installing the tools you need and working with the lab materials.**
  • See https://lse-me314.github.io/instructions for detailed instructions on obtaining and working with each day‚Äôs lab materials.
  • The class assignment for Day 5 will count as the mid-term assignment, which will count for 25% of the grade. The mid-term is available here.
  • Instructions: The exam is here. Complete and submit the exam just as you would any lab assignment: by renaming the file, editing the R Markdown, knitting, and submitting through Moodle your knitted HTML file.
  • Lab 1 materials
  • Lab 1 solution as RMarkdown
  • Lecture Notes
  • Lab 2 materials
  • Lab 2 solution as RMarkdown or as HTML.
  • Lecture Notes
  • Lab 3 materials
  • Lab 3 solution as RMarkdown or as HTML.
  • Lab 4 materials
  • Lab 4 solution as RMarkdown or as HTML.
  • Midterm/Lab 5 materials. This is also the mid-term exam.] To submit this, you should upload your single HTML file to the Moodle page by Wednesday 7 August 19:00.
  • Lab 6 materials
  • Lab 7 materials
  • Lab 8 materials
  • Lab 09 materials
  • Lab 10 materials
  • Lab 11 materials

Cyb3rWard0g / HELK

The Hunting ELK
Good Stuff

  • Welcome to HELK! : Enabling Advanced Analytics Capabilities
  • Spark
  • Spark Standalone Mode
  • Setting up a Pentesting.. I mean, a Threat Hunting Lab - Part 5
  • An Integrated API for Mixing Graph and Relational Queries
  • Graph queries in Spark SQL
  • Graphframes Overview
  • Elastic Producs
  • Elastic Subscriptions
  • Elasticsearch Guide
  • spujadas elk-docker
  • deviantony docker-elk

HazyResearch / snorkel

A system for quickly generating training data with weak supervision
Good Stuff

  • As part of this refactor, we will be bringing under one roof a number of projects in the Snorkel ecosystem that have previously been posted in separate repositories‚ÄîSnorkel, Snorkel MeTaL, TANDA, etc.‚Äîand which have been used to achieve state-of-the-art results on the GLUE and SuperGLUE benchmarks, automate cardiac MRI classification and genetic research database curation (as featured in two forthcoming Nature papers), and extract information from electronic health record (EHR) data for national medical device surveillance.
  • We see Snorkel as providing a general framework for many weak supervision techniques, and as defining a new programming model for weakly-supervised machine learning systems.
  • The Role of Massively Multi-Task and Weak Supervision in Software 2.0 (CIDR 2019)
  • Snorkel: Fast Training Set Generation for Information Extraction (SIGMOD DEMO 2017)

MVIG-SJTU / AlphaPose

Real-Time and Accurate Multi-Person Pose Estimation&Tracking System

Pose Estimation

Pose Tracking

CrowdPose

Good Stuff

  • AlphaPose is based on RMPE(ICCV‚Äô17), authored by Hao-shu Fang, Shuqin Xie, Yu-Wing Tai and Cewu Lu, Cewu Lu is the corresponding author. Currently, it is developed and maintained by Hao-shu Fang, Jiefeng Li, Yuliang Xiu and Ruiheng Chang.

python

tkipf / gcn

Implementation of Graph Convolutional Networks in TensorFlow
Good Stuff

  • Thomas Kipf, Graph Convolutional Networks (2016)

Helpsypoo / primer

code that makes videos for this: youtube.com/c/primerlearning
Good Stuff
Requirements

Blender

  • Download
  • API

Script Runner addon for Blender

  • Download

TeX

dvisvgm

  • https://dvisvgm.de/

OpenBabel if you want to do the molecule stuff http://openbabel.org/wiki/Main_Page

  • Chem stuff adapted from here: https://github.com/patrickfuller/blender-chemicals
  • Also helpful: https://patrickfuller.github.io/molecules-from-smiles-molfiles-in-blender/

swift

socketio / socket.io-client-swift

Good Stuff

  • Checkout the FAQs for commonly asked questions.
  • Checkout the 12to13 guide for migrating to v13+ from v12 below.

  • Docs

  • Client
  • Manager
  • Engine
  • Options

awslabs / aws-sdk-ios-samples

This repository has samples that demonstrate various aspects of the AWS SDK for iOS, you can get the SDK source on Github https://github.com/aws-amplify/aws-sdk-ios/
Good Stuff

  • Developer Guide for AWS SDK for iOS

javascript

svaarala / duktape

Duktape - embeddable Javascript engine with a focus on portability and compact footprint
Good Stuff

  • kangax/compat-table

select2 / select2

Select2 is a jQuery based replacement for select boxes. It supports searching, remote data sets, and infinite scrolling of results.
Good Stuff

  • [flat-ui]: http://designmodo.github.io/Flat-UI/

facebook / jest

Delightful JavaScript Testing.
Good Stuff

  • Jest can be used in projects that use webpack to manage assets, styles, and compilation. webpack does offer some unique challenges over other tools. Refer to the webpack guide to get started.

uber / react-map-gl

React friendly API wrapper around MapboxGL JS
Good Stuff

    • In addition to exposing MapboxGL functionality to React apps, react-map-gl also integrates seamlessly with deck.gl.

go

sqshq / sampler

A tool for shell commands execution, visualization and alerting. Configured with a simple YAML file.
Release
Download .exe

graph-gophers / graphql-go

GraphQL server with a focus on ease of use
Good Stuff

  • The goal of this project is to provide full support of the GraphQL draft specification with a set of idiomatic, easy to use Go packages.

entry.title: Github Trending and Good Stuff 2019-08-06
entry.content:
jupyter-notebook

justmarkham / pandas-videos

Jupyter notebook and datasets from the pandas Q&A video series
Good Stuff

  • ufo.csv | Reports of UFO sightings from 1930-2000 | bit.ly/uforeports | National UFO Reporting Center | Web scraping script

dibgerge / ml-coursera-python-assignments

Python assignments for the machine learning class by andrew ng on coursera with complete submission for grading capability and re-written instructions.
Good Stuff

  • Numpy and matplotlib tutorial: We will be using numpy extensively for matrix and vector operations. This is great tutorial to get you started with using numpy and matplotlib for plotting.

python

ddbourgin / numpy-ml

Machine learning, in numpy
Good Stuff

  • SciPy library is also permitted under special

zalandoresearch / fashion-mnist

A MNIST-like fashion product database. Benchmark
üëâ
Good Stuff

    • Fashion-MNIST: Year in Review

  • GAN Playground - Explore Generative Adversarial Nets in your Browser

swift

Toxblh / MTMR

üåü
[My TouchBar My rules]. The TouchBar Customisation App for your MacBook Pro
Release

  • Download lastest release (.dmg) from github

apple / swift-nio

Event-driven network application framework for high performance protocol servers & clients, non-blocking.
Good Stuff

  • Currently SwiftNIO ships with three Bootstrap objects: ServerBootstrap, for bootstrapping listening channels; ClientBootstrap, for bootstrapping client TCP channels; and DatagramBootstrap for bootstrapping UDP channels.
    • API documentation
  • [ch]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Protocols/ChannelHandler.html
  • [c]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Protocols/Channel.html
  • [chc]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/ChannelHandlerContext.html
  • [ec]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/EmbeddedChannel.html
  • [el]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Protocols/EventLoop.html
  • [eel]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/EmbeddedEventLoop.html
  • [elg]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Protocols/EventLoopGroup.html
  • [bb]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Structs/ByteBuffer.html
  • [elf]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/EventLoopFuture.html
  • [elp]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Structs/EventLoopPromise.html
  • [cp]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/ChannelPipeline.html
  • [mtelg]: https://apple.github.io/swift-nio/docs/current/NIO/Classes/MultiThreadedEventLoopGroup.html

LoopKit / Loop

An automated insulin delivery app template for iOS, built on LoopKit
Good Stuff

  • Please visit the Loop Docs for installation, algorithm, and other details.

ReSwift / ReSwift

Unidirectional Data Flow in Swift - Inspired by Redux
Good Stuff

  • You would also define two actions, one for increasing and one for decreasing the counter. In the Getting Started Guide you can find out how to construct complex actions. For the simple actions in this example we can define empty structs that conform to action:
  • A Getting Started Guide that describes the core components of apps built with ReSwift lives here.

javascript

sahat / hackathon-starter

A boilerplate for Node.js web applications
Good Stuff

  • Google Bootstrap - Google-styled theme for Bootstrap.
  • Font Awesome Icons - It‚Äôs already part of the Hackathon Starter, so use this page as a reference.
  • X-editable - Edit form elements inline.
  • Alertify.js - Sweet looking alerts and browser dialogs.
  • selectize.js - Styleable select elements and input tags.
  • blog,
  • More Bluemix samples

ksky521 / nodeppt

This is probably the best web presentation tool so far!
Good Stuff

  • pluginsÔºöÁõÆÂâçÊîØÊåÅ echartsÔºåmermaidÂíå katex ‰∏â‰∏™Êèí‰ª∂
  • ÁõÆÂâç nodeppt ÊîØÊåÅ ÂõæË°® echartsÔºåÊµÅÁ®ãÂõæ mermaidÔºåÊï∞Â≠¶Á¨¶Âè∑ KaTeX ‰∏â‰∏™Êèí‰ª∂„ÄÇ

Kickball / awesome-selfhosted

This is a list of Free Software network services and web applications which can be hosted locally. Selfhosting is the process of locally hosting and managing applications instead of renting from SaaS providers.
Good Stuff

  • Alltube - Web interface for youtube-dl, a program to download videos and audio from more than 100 websites (Source Code) GPL-3.0 PHP
  • homebank-converter - Web app to convert an export bank file to compatible Homebank csv. (Demo) AGPL-3.0 HTML5
  • Kibitzr - Lightweight personal web assistant with powerful integrations. (Source Code) MIT Python
  • SickRage - SickRage is an automatic Video Library Manager for TV Shows. Automatic torrent/nzb searching, downloading, and processing at the qualities you want. (Source Code) GPL-3.0 Python
  • WebUI-aria2 - Interface to interact with the aria2 downloader. Very simple to use, just download and open index.html in any web browser. (Demo) MIT HTML5
  • Friends - P2P chat powered by the web. (Source Code) MIT Nodejs
  • Lets-Chat - Self hosted chat suite written in Node. (Source Code) MIT Nodejs
  • Haraka - High-performance, pluginable SMTP server written in Javascript. (Source Code) MIT Javascript
  • The Lounge - A self-hosted web IRC client. (Demo, Source Code) MIT Nodejs
  • dyu/comments - Real-time, markdown-enabled comment engine powered by leveldb. (Demo) Apache-2.0 Java
  • Candy - Multi user XMPP client written in Javascript. (Source Code) MIT Javascript
  • frab - web-based conference planning and management system. It helps to collect submissions, to manage talks and speakers and to create a schedule. (Source Code) MIT Ruby
  • OpenEats - Recipe management site that allows users to create, store, share and rate recipes, create grocery lists, and more. (Demo) MIT Python
  • Apaxy - Theme built to enhance the experience of browsing web directories, using the mod_autoindex Apache module and some CSS to override the default style of a directory listing. (Source Code) Unlicense HTML
  • explorer - Highly-configurable directory listing made with nodejs. (Source Code) MIT Nodejs
  • Clumsy Bird - MelonJS port of the famous Flappy Bird Game. (Demo) MIT Nodejs
  • SourceBans++ - Admin, ban, and communication management system for games running on the Source engine. (Source Code) CC-BY-SA-4.0 PHP
  • My Mind - Web application for creating and managing mind maps. (Demo) MIT Javascript
  • Orion - Powerful OwnTracks API-compliant location data visualization frontend for the web. (Demo) MIT Python/Nodejs
  • Darwin Streaming Server - High performance server for streaming QuickTime and MPEG-4 media over RTP and RTSP protocols. Originated as Apple‚Äôs QTSS. (Source Code) APSL-2.0 C++
  • Airsonic - Open-source web-based media streamer and jukebox. A fork of Subsonic‚Äôs last open-source release, before it switched licenses. (Source Code, Clients) GPL-3.0 Java
  • Restreamer - Restreamer allows you to do h.264 real-time video streaming on your website without a streaming provider. (Source Code) Apache-2.0 Nodejs/Docker
  • Fava - Fava is the web frontend of Beancount, a text based double-entry accounting system. (Demo, Source Code) MIT Python
  • OpenNote - OpenNote was built to be an open web-based alternative to Microsoft OneNote (T) and EverNote. (Demo) MIT HTML5
  • turndown - HTML to Markdown converter written in JavaScript. (Source Code) MIT Javascript
  • Snibox - Code snippets manager with attractive tag-oriented interface. (Demo, Source Code) MIT Ruby
  • simple-dash - A simple, fully responsive Dashboard to forward to the services of your choice. (Demo) MIT Javascript
  • Gallery CSS - Gallery.css is all CSS. Think: Simple, maintainable and understandable galleries without the use of Javascript. (Source Code) MIT CSS
  • Lychee - Open source grid and album based photo-management-system. (Source Code) MIT PHP
  • miniProxy - Simple web proxy written in PHP that can allow you to bypass Internet content filters, or to browse the internet anonymously. Only one php file. (Source Code) GPL-3.0 PHP
  • Swiperproxy - Lightning-fast, open source web proxy that is easy for you to run and customize. (Source Code) MIT Python
  • Searx - Privacy-respecting, hackable metasearch engine. (Demo, Source Code) AGPL-3.0 Python
  • gitbucket - The easily installable GitHub clone powered by Scala. (Source Code) Apache-2.0 Scala/Java
  • todoMini - Mobile friendly zero-feature TODO list web app. Unix philosophy. (Demo, Source Code) GPL-3.0 PHP/Clojure
  • Wekan - Open-source Trello-like kanban. (Demo, Source Code) MIT Nodejs
  • DPlatform - Deploy self-hosted apps easily: simple, bloat-free, independent installation. (Source Code) MIT Shell
  • Lists of software aimed at privacy and decentralization in some form: PRISM Break, privacytools.io, Alternative Internet, Libre Projects

facebook / react-native

A framework for building native apps with React.
Good Stuff

                • [p]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/out-of-tree-platforms
  • Follow the Getting Started guide. The recommended way to install React Native depends on your project. Here you can find short guides for the most common scenarios:
  • [new-app]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/getting-started.html
  • [existing]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/integration-with-existing-apps.html
  • [docs]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/getting-started.html
  • [u]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/upgrading
  • [contribute]: https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/contributing

ipfs-shipyard / ipfs-desktop

Menubar IPFS Application
Release

  • Mac - ipfs-desktop-0.8.0.dmg
  • Windows - ipfs-desktop-setup-0.8.0.exe
    | Windows | ipfs-desktop-setup-0.8.0.exe |
    | Mac | ipfs-desktop-0.8.0.dmg |

ppoffice / hexo-theme-icarus

A simple, delicate, and modern theme for the static site generator Hexo.
Good Stuff

  • Changyan
  • Disqus
  • Facebook
  • Gitment
  • Isso
  • LiveRe
  • Valine
  • Insight Search
  • Google Custom Search Engine
  • Baidu Site Search
  • AddThis
  • AddToAny
  • Baidu Share
  • Share.js
  • ShareThis
  • Alipay
  • Wechat
  • Paypal
  • Patreon
  • Hexo Tag Plugin
  • lightGallery & Justified Gallery
  • MathJax
  • Site Analytics

facebook / create-react-app

Set up a modern web app by running one command.
Good Stuff

  • User Guide ‚Äì How to develop apps bootstrapped with Create React App.
  • Read more about testing.
  • You can find detailed instructions on using Create React App and many tips in its documentation.
  • Please refer to the User Guide for this and other information.
  • An offline-first service worker and a web app manifest, meeting all the Progressive Web App criteria. (Note: Using the service worker is opt-in as of react-scripts@2.0.0 and higher)
  • The tradeoff is that these tools are preconfigured to work in a specific way. If your project needs more customization, you can ‚Äúeject‚Äù and customize it, but then you will need to maintain this configuration.

entry.title: Github Trending and Good Stuff 2019-08-05
entry.content:
jupyter-notebook

jakevdp / PythonDataScienceHandbook

Python Data Science Handbook: full text in Jupyter Notebooks
Good Stuff

  • Read the book in its entirety online at https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/

m2dsupsdlclass / lectures-labs

Slides and Jupyter notebooks for the Deep Learning lectures at M2 Data Science Universit√© Paris Saclay
Good Stuff

    • Intro to Deep Learning
    • Neural Networks and Backpropagation
    • Embeddings and Recommender Systems
    • Convolutional Neural Networks for Image Classification
    • Deep Learning for Object Detection and Image Segmentation
    • Recurrent Neural Networks and NLP
    • Sequence to sequence, attention and memory
    • Expressivity, Optimization and Generalization
    • Imbalanced classification and metric learning
    • Unsupervised Deep Learning and Generative models

Burton2000 / CS231n-2017

Completed the CS231n 2017 spring assignments from Stanford university
Good Stuff

  • These are my solutions to the CS231n Spring 2017 course from Stanford University http://cs231n.github.io/.

python

wistbean / learn_python3_spider

pythonÁà¨Ëô´ÊïôÁ®ãÁ≥ªÂàó„ÄÅ‰ªé0Âà∞1Â≠¶‰π†pythonÁà¨Ëô´ÔºåÂåÖÊã¨ÊµèËßàÂô®ÊäìÂåÖÔºåÊâãÊú∫APPÊäìÂåÖÔºåÂ¶Ç fiddler„ÄÅmitmproxyÔºåÂêÑÁßçÁà¨Ëô´Ê∂âÂèäÁöÑÊ®°ÂùóÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî®ÔºåÂ¶ÇÔºörequests„ÄÅbeautifulSoup„ÄÅselenium„ÄÅappium„ÄÅscrapyÁ≠âÔºå‰ª•ÂèäIP‰ª£ÁêÜÔºåÈ™åËØÅÁ†ÅËØÜÂà´ÔºåMysqlÔºåMongoDBÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìÁöÑpython‰ΩøÁî®ÔºåÂ§öÁ∫øÁ®ãÂ§öËøõÁ®ãÁà¨Ëô´ÁöÑ‰ΩøÁî®Ôºåcss Áà¨Ëô´Âä†ÂØÜÈÄÜÂêëÁ†¥Ëß£ÔºåJSÁà¨Ëô´ÈÄÜÂêëÔºåÁà¨Ëô´È°πÁõÆÂÆûÊàòÂÆû‰æãÁ≠â
Good Stuff

  • pythonÊïôÁ®ãËµÑÊ∫ê

williamFalcon / pytorch-lightning

Rapid research framework for PyTorch. The researcher‚Äôs version of Keras
Good Stuff

  • View the docs here
  • Define a LightningModel
  • Fit with a trainer
  • Lightning automates all of the following (each is also configurable):
  • Model saving
  • Model loading
  • Running grid search on a cluster
  • Walltime auto-resubmit
  • Fast dev run
  • Inspect gradient norms
  • Log GPU usage
  • Make model overfit on subset of data
  • Print the parameter count by layer
  • Print which gradients are nan
  • 16-bit mixed precision
  • Multi-GPU
  • Multi-node
  • Single GPU
  • Self-balancing architecture
  • Display metrics in progress bar
  • Log metric row every k batches
  • Process position
  • Tensorboard support
  • Save a snapshot of all hyperparameters
  • Snapshot code for a training run
  • Write logs file to csv every k batches
  • Accumulate gradients
  • Force training for min or max epochs
  • Force disable early stop
  • Gradient Clipping
  • Hooks
  • Learning rate scheduling
  • Use multiple optimizers (like GANs)
  • Set how much of the training set to check (1-100%)
  • Check validation every n epochs
  • Hooks
  • Set how much of the validation set to check
  • Set how much of the test set to check
  • Set validation check frequency within 1 training epoch
  • Set the number of validation sanity steps

donnemartin / system-design-primer

Learn how to design large-scale systems. Prep for the system design interview. Includes Anki flashcards.
Good Stuff

  • A distributed systems reading list

apachecn / AiLearning

AiLearning: Êú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π† - MachineLearning - ML„ÄÅÊ∑±Â∫¶Â≠¶‰π† - DeepLearning - DL„ÄÅËá™ÁÑ∂ËØ≠Ë®ÄÂ§ÑÁêÜ NLP
Good Stuff

  • Python Ëá™ÁÑ∂ËØ≠Ë®ÄÂ§ÑÁêÜ Á¨¨‰∫åÁâà: https://usyiyi.github.io/nlp-py-2e-zh
  • Êé®Ëçê‰∏Ä‰∏™liuhuanyongÂ§ß‰Ω¨Êï¥ÁêÜÁöÑnlpÂÖ®Èù¢Áü•ËØÜ‰ΩìÁ≥ª: https://liuhuanyong.github.io
  • ÊñØÂù¶Á¶èÈóÆÈ¢òÂõûÁ≠îÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºàSQuADÔºâ„ÄÇÂõûÁ≠îÊúâÂÖ≥Áª¥Âü∫ÁôæÁßëÊñáÁ´†ÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢ò„ÄÇ

swift

SwiftyJSON / SwiftyJSON

The better way to deal with JSON data in Swift.
Good Stuff

  • ‰∏≠Êñá‰ªãÁªç

vsouza / awesome-ios

A curated list of awesome iOS ecosystem, including Objective-C and Swift Projects
Good Stuff

  • Swifteducation - Teaching App Development with Swift
  • Auto Layout Magic - Build 1 scene, let Auto Layout Magic generate the constraints for you! Scenes look great across all devices!
  • Siesta - Elegant abstraction for RESTful resources that untangles stateful messes. An alternative to callback- and delegate-based networking.
  • ios-driver - Test any iOS native, hybrid, or mobile web application using Selenium / WebDriver.
  • Xcode Maven - The Xcode Maven Plugin can be used in order to run Xcode builds embedded in a Maven lifecycle.
  • WWDC-Recap - A collection of session summaries in markdown format, from WWDC 19 & 17.
  • Swift Weekly Brief - A community-driven weekly newsletter about Swift.org. Curated by Jesse Squires and published for free every Thursday

matteocrippa / awesome-swift

A collaborative list of awesome Swift libraries and resources. Feel free to contribute!
Good Stuff

  • Swift Weekly Brief - A multi author curated newsletter.
  • Google - This style guide is based on Apple‚Äôs excellent Swift standard library style and also incorporates feedback from usage across multiple Swift projects within Google.
  • Siesta - Elegant abstraction for REST APIs that untangles stateful messes. An alternative to callback- and delegate-based networking.
  • Prototope - Library of lightweight interfaces for prototyping, bridged to JS.

javascript

sahat / hackathon-starter

A boilerplate for Node.js web applications
Good Stuff

  • Google Bootstrap - Google-styled theme for Bootstrap.
  • Font Awesome Icons - It‚Äôs already part of the Hackathon Starter, so use this page as a reference.
  • X-editable - Edit form elements inline.
  • Alertify.js - Sweet looking alerts and browser dialogs.
  • selectize.js - Styleable select elements and input tags.
  • blog,
  • More Bluemix samples

lllyasviel / style2paints

sketch + style = paints
üé®
Good Stuff

  • User Instruction: https://style2paints.github.io/
  • User Instruction: https://style2paints.github.io/

d07RiV / diabloweb

Diablo 1 for web browsers
Good Stuff

  • The project is hosted on https://d07RiV.github.io/diabloweb/ along with spawn.mpq from the shareware version (place it in the public folder to run locally).

hta218 / get-a-room-api-docs

üìö
APIs documentation for Room Finder
Good Stuff

  • Preview: https://hta218.github.io/get-a-room-api-docs/

lutzroeder / netron

Visualizer for neural network, deep learning and machine learning models
Release
macOS: Download the .dmg file or run brew cask install netron
Windows: Download the .exe installer.

mayeaux / videodownloader

A video and channel downloader that supports 110 websites, powered by Electron and youtube-dl
Release
Installer for OS X available: Here
Installer for Windows available: Here

Manuel-777 / MTG-Arena-Tool

An MTG Arena deck and statistics manager
Good Stuff

  • Conic Gradient Polyfill by Lea Verou

FaisalUmair / udemy-downloader-gui

entry.content:
‰ΩøÁî®ExcelÂª∫Á´ãÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ËØÑÂàÜÊ®°Âûã

ÂáÜÂ§áÂÜô‰∏Ä‰ªΩÊùêÊñôÂÖ≥‰∫é„Ää‰ΩøÁî®ExcelÂª∫Á´ãÊú∫Âô®Â≠¶‰π†ËØÑÂàÜÊ®°Âûã„ÄãÔºåÊàêÂûãÁöÑExcelÊ®°ÊùøÂ∑≤ÁªèÊúâ‰∫ÜÔºàÁ¨îËÄÖËá™Â∑±ÂºÄÂèëÁöÑÔºâÔºåÂÖ∑‰ΩìÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊïàÊûúÊà™Â±èËßÅÊñáÊú´„ÄÇÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìÊúâÂ§öÂ∞ë‰∫∫ÊÑøÊÑè‰∫ÜËß£Ôºü

‰ª•‰∏ãÊòØÊùêÊñôÂ§ßÁ∫≤Ôºö

‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πà‰ΩøÁî®Excel

    ÂæÆËΩØÔºö2016Âπ¥3ÊúàOfficeÁî®Êà∑ÈáèË∂Ö12‰∫ø

    Ê†πÊçÆÂæÆËΩØÂÆòÊñπÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÁöÑÊï∞Â≠óÊòæÁ§∫ÔºåOfficeÁöÑÂÖ®ÁêÉÁî®Êà∑ÈáèËææÂà∞‰∫Ü12‰∫øÔºåËÄåExcelÊòØOffice‰∏≠Â∏∏Áî®ÁöÑÂ•ó‰ª∂Â∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇ

  • ËÆ°ÁÆóÊÄßËÉΩ

    Office Excel 2016 ‰∏≠ÂåÖÂê´ 100 ‰∏áË°åÂíå 16,000 ÂàóÁöÑ‚ÄúÂ§ßÁΩëÊ†º‚ÄùÔºåÂä†‰∏äÂ§öÈ°πÂÖ∂‰ªñ‰∏äÈôêË¢´Ë∞ÉÈ´òÔºå‰∏é Excel ÂÖàÂâçÁâàÊú¨Áõ∏ÊØîÊûÅÂ§ßÂú∞Â¢ûÂä†‰∫Ü‰Ω†ÂèØÂàõÂª∫ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúË°®ÁöÑÂ§ßÂ∞è„ÄÇ Excel ‰∏≠Âçï‰∏™Â∑•‰ΩúË°®ÂèØÂåÖÂê´ÁöÑÂçïÂÖÉÊ†ºÊï∞Áé∞ËææÂà∞ÂÖàÂâçÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑ 1,000 ÂÄç‰ª•‰∏ä„ÄÇ

    Êú¨Ê°à‰æãÈúÄË¶Å Office 2007 Êàñ‰ª•‰∏äÁâàÊú¨„ÄÇ

  • ÂÖ∂‰ªñ‰ºòÁÇπ

    • ‰∏çÁî®ÂÜô‰ª£Á†Å

      Ê≤°Êúâ‰ª£Á†ÅÁºñÁ®ãË¶ÅÊ±ÇÔºåÂè™ÈúÄË¶ÅÁêÜËß£ÂÖ¨Âºè

    • Êõ¥Áõ¥ËßÇ

      ExcelËá™Â∏¶ÁöÑË°®Ê†º‰ª•ÂèäÂõæË°®ËÉΩÊõ¥Ê∏ÖÊô∞Â±ïÁ§∫Êï∞ÊçÆÂíåÊ®°Âûã

    • Ëß£ÈáäÊÄßÂº∫

      Ê°à‰æãÈááÁî®Logistic RegressionÁÆóÊ≥ïÔºåÂπ∂ÁªìÂêàËØÑÂàÜÊ®°ÂûãÊñπÊ≥ïËÆ∫„ÄÇËØ•ÊñπÊ≥ïËÆ∫ÂÆåÊï¥Ë¥ØÁ©øÂπ∂Â±ïÁ§∫Ê®°ÂûãÁöÑÊúâÊïàÊÄß„ÄÅÂå∫ÂàÜÂ∫¶„ÄÅÁ®≥ÂÆöÊÄß„ÄÇÊï∞ÊçÆÂèòÈáèÂØπÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑË¥°ÁåÆÔºå‰ª•ÂèäËÉΩÁªìÂêàÂÆûÈôÖÂïÜ‰∏ö‰∏öÂä°ÁöÑÁêÜËß£„ÄÇ

  • ÊñáÁ´†ËåÉÂõ¥

    • ‰ΩøÁî®‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÊ°à‰æã

      ÊãüÈááÁî®GermanCreditÊï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºàÊñáÊú´Êà™Â±èÊòØÂè¶Â§ñ‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï∞ÊçÆÈõÜÔºâ

    • ÂÖ®ÈÉ®‰ΩøÁî®ExcelÂÆûÁé∞Ê®°ÂûãÂª∫Á´ãËøáÁ®ã

      ‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÈ¢ùÂ§ñÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ËæÖÂä©ÔºåÂª∫Ê®°ÂÖ®ÊµÅÁ®ãÈÉΩÂú®ExcelÂÜÖÂÆåÊàê

ÂÖ≥‰∫éLogistic Regression

  • Á∫øÊÄßÊ®°Âûã
  • Logistic Regression

Excel Ê≠•È™§ÂÆûÁé∞

  • Ê®°ÂûãÊñπÊ≥ïËÆ∫
    • Binning
    • WOE
    • IV
    • Odds
    • KS
  • ÁêÜËß£Êï∞ÊçÆ
  • ËßÇÂØüÊï∞ÊçÆ
  • Âª∫Ê®°Ê≠•È™§

Ê®°ÂûãÁõëÊéß

  • ÊéíÂ∫èÊÄß

Êó†ÂõæÊó†ÁúüÁõ∏Ôºö

ËøòÊúâÂà´ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÁâπÁÇπÊ≤°ÊúâÊîæÂá∫Êù•ÔºåÁúãÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÊúâÊ≤°ÊúâÂÖ¥Ë∂£‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

entry.title: TensorFlow ÂçáÁ∫ßÂà∞2.0ÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑ1.xÁ®ãÂ∫èÊÄé‰πàÂäûÔºü
entry.content:
TensorFlow ÂçáÁ∫ßÂà∞2.0ÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑ1.xÁ®ãÂ∫èÊÄé‰πàÂäûÔºü

ÁõÆÂâçÔºåTensorflowÂ∫ìÊ≠£Âú®ÁªèÂéÜÁùÄ‰ªéÊé®Âá∫‰ª•Êù•ÊúÄÂ§ßËßÑÊ®°ÁöÑÂèòÂåñ„ÄÇTensorFLow 2.0 Â∑≤ÁªèÊé®Âá∫ beta ÁâàÊú¨ÔºåÂêå TensorFlow 1.x ÁâàÊú¨Áõ∏ÊØîÂÆÉÂ∏¶Êù•‰∫ÜÂ§™Â§öÁöÑÊîπÂèò„ÄÇÊúÄÂ§ßÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÂú®‰∫é‰∏çÂÖºÂÆπ‰∫ÜÂ•ΩÂ§öTensorFlow 1.x ÁâàÊú¨ÁöÑAPI„ÄÇ

ÊÄé‰πàÂäûÔºü

ÁâàÊú¨ÈÄâÊã©

ËôΩÁÑ∂TensorFlowÁöÑ2.0ÁâàÊú¨‰∏≠ÔºåÂ¢ûÂä†‰∫ÜÂæàÂ§öÂÖâÈ≤úÈùì‰∏ΩÁöÑÊñ∞ÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊòØTensorFlow 1.xÁõÆÂâçÊØîËæÉÁ®≥ÂÆöÔºåÂª∫ËÆÆ‰ΩøÁî®TensorFlow 1.xÁâàÊú¨ÂºÄÂèëÂÆûÈôÖÈ°πÁõÆÔºåÂπ∂Ë∑üËøõ2.xÁâàÊú¨ÊâÄÊõ¥Êñ∞ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØ„ÄÇÁ≠âÂà∞2.xÁâàÊú¨Êõ¥‰∏∫Á®≥ÂÆöÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÊâçËÄÉËôëÂ∞ÜÂÆûÈôÖÈ°πÁõÆÂàáÊç¢Âà∞2.x„ÄÇ

Â∫îÂØπÊñπÊ°à

TensorFlowÊ°ÜÊû∂ÁöÑ1.xÁâàÊú¨‰∏é2.xÁâàÊú¨Â∑ÆÂºÇËæÉÂ§ß„ÄÇÂª∫ËÆÆÈááÁî®1.x‰∏é2.xÁâàÊú¨ÂÖ±Â≠òÁöÑÊñπÂºèÊù•Ëß£ÂÜ≥„ÄÇ

AnacondaÂàõÂª∫ËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢É

  • Êü•ÁúãÁõÆÂâçÁöÑËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢É

    ‰ΩøÁî®conda info --envsÊü•ÁúãÂΩìÂâçÁéØÂ¢É‰ø°ÊÅØ

    # conda environments:#base                  *  /anaconda3

    ÊòæÁ§∫ÁªìÊûú‰∏≠ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÔºåÂΩìÂâçËôöÁéØÂ¢ÉÁöÑÂêçÂ≠óÊòØ‚Äúbase‚ÄùÔºåÊòØAnacondaÈªòËÆ§ÁöÑPythonÁéØÂ¢É„ÄÇ

  • ‰ΩøÁî®python --versionÊù•Êü•ÁúãPythonÁâàÊú¨

    Python 3.7.3

    ÂèØ‰ª•Áü•ÈÅìÔºåÂΩìÂâçPythonÁâàÊú¨‰∏∫3.7.3„ÄÇ

  • ÂàõÂª∫PythonËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢É

    conda create --name tf2 python=3.7.3

    The following packages will be downloaded:    package                    |            build    ---------------------------|-----------------    ca-certificates-2019.5.15  |                0         133 KB    certifi-2019.6.16          |           py37_0         154 KB    openssl-1.1.1c             |       h1de35cc_1         3.4 MB    pip-19.1.1                 |           py37_0         1.8 MB    setuptools-41.0.1          |           py37_0         635 KB    sqlite-3.29.0              |       ha441bb4_0         2.4 MB    wheel-0.33.4               |           py37_0          39 KB    ------------------------------------------------------------                                           Total:         8.5 MBThe following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:  ca-certificates    pkgs/main/osx-64::ca-certificates-2019.5.15-0  certifi            pkgs/main/osx-64::certifi-2019.6.16-py37_0  libcxx             pkgs/main/osx-64::libcxx-4.0.1-hcfea43d_1  libcxxabi          pkgs/main/osx-64::libcxxabi-4.0.1-hcfea43d_1  libedit            pkgs/main/osx-64::libedit-3.1.20181209-hb402a30_0  libffi             pkgs/main/osx-64::libffi-3.2.1-h475c297_4  ncurses            pkgs/main/osx-64::ncurses-6.1-h0a44026_1  openssl            pkgs/main/osx-64::openssl-1.1.1c-h1de35cc_1  pip                pkgs/main/osx-64::pip-19.1.1-py37_0  python             pkgs/main/osx-64::python-3.7.3-h359304d_0  readline           pkgs/main/osx-64::readline-7.0-h1de35cc_5  setuptools         pkgs/main/osx-64::setuptools-41.0.1-py37_0  sqlite             pkgs/main/osx-64::sqlite-3.29.0-ha441bb4_0  tk                 pkgs/main/osx-64::tk-8.6.8-ha441bb4_0  wheel              pkgs/main/osx-64::wheel-0.33.4-py37_0  xz                 pkgs/main/osx-64::xz-5.2.4-h1de35cc_4  zlib               pkgs/main/osx-64::zlib-1.2.11-h1de35cc_3

    Proceed ([y]/n)?

    ÂàõÂª∫ËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠‰ºöÊèêÁ§∫ÊòØÂê¶ÂÆâË£ÖÂØπÂ∫îËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖÔºåËæìÂÖ•‚ÄúY‚ÄùÔºåÂàô‰∏ãËΩΩÂèäÂÆâË£ÖËΩØ‰ª∂ÂåÖ„ÄÇ

    Downloading and Extracting Packageswheel-0.33.4         | 39 KB     | ############################################################ | 100% openssl-1.1.1c       | 3.4 MB    | ############################################################ | 100% certifi-2019.6.16    | 154 KB    | ############################################################ | 100% setuptools-41.0.1    | 635 KB    | ############################################################ | 100% pip-19.1.1           | 1.8 MB    | ############################################################ | 100% sqlite-3.29.0        | 2.4 MB    | ############################################################ | 100% ca-certificates-2019 | 133 KB    | ############################################################ | 100% Preparing transaction: doneVerifying transaction: doneExecuting transaction: done## To activate this environment, use##     $ conda activate tf2## To deactivate an active environment, use##     $ conda deactivate

    ËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢Étf2ÂàõÂª∫ÊàêÂäü„ÄÇ

    conda activate tf2             #Â∞ÜËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢Étf2‰Ωú‰∏∫ÂΩìÂâçÁöÑPythonÁéØÂ¢Éconda deactivate               #‰ΩøÁî®ÈªòËÆ§ÁöÑPythonÁéØÂ¢É

    Â¶ÇÊûú‰ΩøÁî®WindowsÔºåÊøÄÊ¥ªÂíåÂèñÊ∂àÊøÄÊ¥ªËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢ÉÁöÑÂëΩ‰ª§Â¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö

    activate tf2deactivate

  • Ê£ÄÊü•PythonËôöÁéØÂ¢ÉÊòØÂê¶ÂàõÂª∫ÊàêÂäü

    ÊòæÁ§∫Ôºö

    ÂèØ‰ª•ÁúãÂà∞ÔºåËôöÁéØÂ¢É‰∏≠Â§ö‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™‚Äútf2‚ÄùÔºåË°®Á§∫ÂàõÂª∫ÊàêÂäü„ÄÇ

  • Âà†Èô§PythonËôöÁéØÂ¢É

    conda remove --name tf2 --all

    ËøêË°å‰ª•‰∏äÂëΩ‰ª§Âç≥ÂèØÂà†Èô§tf2ËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢ÉÔºå‰∏ç‰ºöÊúâ‰ªª‰ΩïÊòæÁ§∫„ÄÇÂèØ‰ª•‰ΩøÁî®conda info --envsÂÜçÊ¨°Ê£ÄÊü•ËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢ÉÊÉÖÂÜµ„ÄÇ

  • Âú®PythonËôöÁéØÂ¢É‰∏≠ÂÆâË£ÖTensorFlow 2.0

    conda activate tf2                    #ÊøÄÊ¥ªtf2ËôöÊãüÁéØÂ¢Épip install tensorflow==2.0.0-alpha0  #ÂÆâË£ÖTensorFlow 2.0Áâà

  • Áî®Â∑•ÂÖ∑ËøõË°å‰ª£Á†ÅÁâàÊú¨ÂçáÁ∫ß

    Âú®TensorFlow 2.xÁâàÊú¨‰∏≠ÔºåÊèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçáÁ∫ßTensorFlow 1.xÁâàÊú¨‰ª£Á†ÅÁöÑÂ∑•ÂÖ∑‚Äî‚Äîtf_upgrade_v2„ÄÇËØ•Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÂèØ‰ª•ÈùûÂ∏∏Êñπ‰æøÂú∞Â∞ÜTensorFlow 1.xÁâàÊú¨‰∏≠ÁºñÂÜôÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÁßªÊ§çÂà∞TensorFlow 2.x‰∏≠„ÄÇ

    tf_upgrade_v2 --infile "1.x‰ª£Á†ÅÊñá‰ª∂"  -outfile "2.x‰ª£Á†ÅÊñá‰ª∂"

    tf_upgrade_v2Â∑•ÂÖ∑ÊîØÊåÅÂçïÊñá‰ª∂ËΩ¨Êç¢ÂíåÂ§öÊñá‰ª∂ÊâπÈáèËΩ¨Êç¢‰∏§ÁßçÊñπÂºè„ÄÇ

    1. Âçï‰∏™‰ª£Á†ÅÂçáÁ∫ß

      tf_upgrade_v2 --infile foo_v1.py  --outfile foo_v2.py

    2. ÊâπÈáè‰ª£Á†ÅÂçáÁ∫ß

      tf_upgrade_v2 -intree foo_v1  -outtree foo_v2

      ËøôÈáåÁöÑfoo_v1ÊåáÁöÑÊòØ1.x‰ª£Á†ÅÊñá‰ª∂ÁõÆÂΩïÔºåfoo_v2ÊåáÁöÑÊòØÂçáÁ∫ßÂêéÁöÑ2.x‰ª£Á†ÅÊñá‰ª∂Â≠òÊîæÁõÆÂΩï„ÄÇ

      ÈúÄË¶ÅÊ≥®ÊÑèÁöÑÊòØtf_upgrade_v2Â∑•ÂÖ∑Âπ∂‰∏çÊòØ‰∏áËÉΩÁöÑÔºåÂÆÉÂè™ËÉΩÂÆûÁé∞Âü∫Êú¨ÁöÑAPIÂçáÁ∫ß„ÄÇ‰∏ÄËà¨Âú®ËΩ¨ÂåñÂÆåÊàê‰πãÂêéËøòÈúÄË¶ÅÊâãÂä®‰∫åÊ¨°‰øÆÊîπ„ÄÇ

  • 2.xÁâàÊú¨ÂØπ‰∫éTF-Hub„ÄÅT2TÁ≠âÂ∫ìÁöÑÂΩ±Âìç

    Ê≤°ÊúâÂΩ±Âìç„ÄÇËøô‰∏§‰∏™Â∫ìÂêåÊó∂ÊîØÊåÅ1.x‰ª•Âèä2.x„ÄÇ
